abstract_summ: Conclusion: Italian dentists were informed correctly on the mode of transmission but partially missed COVID-19 symptoms.Only a small number of dentists (n = 72, 2.00%) were confident of avoiding infection; dentists working in low COVID-19 prevalence areas were more confident than those working in the Milan area and high prevalence area (61.24%, 61.23%, and 64.29%, p < 0.01 respectively).Conclusions This group of Jordanian dentists was generally aware of COVID-19 symptoms and mode of transmission.OBJECTIVE: To ascertain the level of understanding of senior dental students regarding the infection control in the dental practice.The aim of this study is an evaluation of the Italian dentists’ knowledge regarding COVID-19 and their perception of the risks associated with COVID-19, their attitude in resuming their activities, and how they judge the institutional intervention on a health and economic basis.
title_summ: A Questionnaire SurveyCOVID-19 Outbreak Perception in Italian DentistsFear and Practice Modifications among Dentists to Combat Novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) OutbreakDentists thoughts about COVID-19Career Prospects of Young Dentists in SwitzerlandOccupational Exposure to Blood and Body Fluids among Medical Laboratory Science Students of the University of Health and Allied Sciences during Vocational Internship in the Volta Region of GhanaTo investigate the association between the health literacy and hand hygiene practices of the older adults to help them fight against infectious diseases in Hong KongAssessment of correlates of hand hygiene compliance among final year medical students: a cross-sectional study in the NetherlandsPotential Barriers amongst Health Care Professionals of Pakistan in managing COVID-19 patientsEpidemiological Aspects and Psychological Reactions to COVID-19 of Dental Practitioners in the Northern Italy Districts of Modena and Reggio EmiliaCOVID-19 Outbreak in North Italy: An Overview on Dentistry.A Cross-Sectional Study in a Teaching Hospital, Rawalpindi, PakistanNurses’ attitude towards oral care and their practicing level for hospitalized patients in Orotta National Referral Hospital, Asmara-Eritrea: a cross-sectional studyPerceived vulnerability to Coronavirus infection: impact on dental practice.The Attitudes and Professional Approaches of Dental Practitioners during the COVID-19 Outbreak in Poland: A Cross-Sectional Survey.What Do the Dental Students Know about Infection Control?
title_abstract_phrases: Conclusions This group of Jordanian dentists was generally aware of COVID-19 symptoms and mode of transmission.OBJECTIVE: To ascertain the level of understanding of senior dental students regarding the infection control in the dental practice.The survey was aimed at highlighting the practical and emotional consequences of COVID-19 emergence on daily clinical practice.Conclusion: Italian dentists were informed correctly on the mode of transmission but partially missed COVID-19 symptoms.Only a small number of dentists (n = 72, 2.00%) were confident of avoiding infection; dentists working in low COVID-19 prevalence areas were more confident than those working in the Milan area and high prevalence area (61.24%, 61.23%, and 64.29%, p < 0.01 respectively).
